message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it deals with online convex optimization, which is a key problem in large scale machine learning. Additionally, the paper discusses the development of new algorithms for tightening regret bounds in easy data instances, which is a common problem in machine learning. 

The paper may also belong to the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as machine learning is a subfield of AI. 

The sub-category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is also a possibility as the paper discusses the development of new update rules for online convex optimization, which involves the use of algorithms and data structures. 

The sub-category of cs.IT (Information Theory) is another possibility as the paper discusses the use of predictable sequences in online convex optimization, which is related to information theory. 

Finally, the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is a possibility as the paper discusses the use of adaptive and dynamic update rules, which are commonly used in neural networks and evolutionary algorithms.
